api/DataLayer.CelestialDataPackage-1.htm.summary: Class CelestialDataPackage<T> Namespace DataLayer Assembly DataLayer.dll Encapsulates all data returned in the Horizontal Coordinate system from the DataLayer needed by the front end to display astronomical objects Author: Josh Johner Created: SPR 2025. public class CelestialDataPackage<T> Type Parameters T The class type of star that is used in the database Inheritance object CelestialDataPackage<T> Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors CelestialDataPackage(IEnumerable<HorizontalStar>, IEquatorialCalculator, IEnumerable<HorizontalMessierObject>, IEnumerable<Constellation>, IEnumerable<HorizontalPlanet>?, HorizontalMoon, HorizontalSun) Used by the StargazerRepositoryService<T> to pack up the data and return it. All values are from the user's perspective. internal CelestialDataPackage(IEnumerable<HorizontalStar> stars, IEquatorialCalculator starCalculator, IEnumerable<HorizontalMessierObject> messierObjects, IEnumerable<Constellation> constellations, IEnumerable<HorizontalPlanet>? planets, HorizontalMoon moon, HorizontalSun sun) Parameters stars IEnumerable<HorizontalStar> A List<T> to be drawn. starCalculator IEquatorialCalculator The star calculator for the current lat/long. messierObjects IEnumerable<HorizontalMessierObject> A List<T> to be drawn. constellations IEnumerable<Constellation> A List<T>s in Horizontal Coordinate form. planets IEnumerable<HorizontalPlanet> A IEnumerable<T> in the solar system from the users perspective. moon HorizontalMoon A HorizontalMoonThe moon object to draw. sun HorizontalSun The HorizontalSun Fields horizontalStars private readonly IEnumerable<HorizontalStar> horizontalStars Field Value IEnumerable<HorizontalStar> Properties Calculator The calculator used to determine the position of the stars. public IEquatorialCalculator Calculator { get; } Property Value IEquatorialCalculator Constellations A collection of Constellations to be displayed. public IEnumerable<Constellation> Constellations { get; } Property Value IEnumerable<Constellation> DrawnStars A dictionary containing the stars that have been drawn in the GUI. public ConcurrentDictionary<int, T> DrawnStars { get; } Property Value ConcurrentDictionary<int, T> HorizontalStars Gets a read only list of stars to be filtered and drawn. public IEnumerable<HorizontalStar> HorizontalStars { get; } Property Value IEnumerable<HorizontalStar> MessierObjects A collection of Messier Deep Space Objects in the Horizontal Coordinate form to be displayed. public IEnumerable<HorizontalMessierObject> MessierObjects { get; } Property Value IEnumerable<HorizontalMessierObject> Moon public HorizontalMoon Moon { get; } Property Value HorizontalMoon Planets A collection of solar planets in horizontal coordinate form. public IEnumerable<HorizontalPlanet>? Planets { get; } Property Value IEnumerable<HorizontalPlanet> Sun public HorizontalSun Sun { get; } Property Value HorizontalSun Methods GetStar(int, Func<HorizontalStar, T>) Searches the dictionary for a HorizontalStar using the Hip ID provided. If found, converts it to a T star, stores it and returns it. If not found, retrieves it from the dictionary of stars already converted and returns it. public T GetStar(int hipId, Func<HorizontalStar, T> SpawnStar) Parameters hipId int The Hipparcos Id of the star SpawnStar Func<HorizontalStar, T> The function provided to spawn a new star in the graphic scene. Must take a HorizontalStar as and argument and return a T star Returns T Exceptions KeyNotFoundException If the star was not found.

Value DateTime selected private DateTime selected Field Value DateTime Properties CalendarButton The button that displays this calendar - can be null. public Button CalendarButton { get; set; } Property Value Button DateTime The date that the calendar is currently displaying. public DateTime DateTime { get; set; } Property Value DateTime Header The header button/text (i.e. "Month" or "Year"). [Export(PropertyHint.None, "")] public Button Header { get; private set; } Property Value Button LowerLimit The earliest date that can be selected. NOTE: Up to the user to implement the functionality. public DateTime LowerLimit { get; set; } Property Value DateTime Margin The vertical space between the calendar and the button that opens it. public float Margin { get; set; } Property Value float Next The button to go the next part of the view (i.e. next month/year). [Export(PropertyHint.None, "")] public BaseButton Next { get; private set; } Property Value BaseButton Previous The button to go the previous part of the view (i.e. next month/year). [Export(PropertyHint.None, "")] public BaseButton Previous { get; private set; } Property Value BaseButton Selected The date that the user has selected. public DateTime Selected { get; set; } Property Value DateTime UpperLimit The latest date that can be selected. NOTE: Up to the user to implement the functionality. public DateTime UpperLimit { get; set; } Property Value DateTime View The ICalendarView currently being displayed. public ICalendarView View { get; } Property Value ICalendarView ViewParent The parent of the ICalendarView. [Export(PropertyHint.None, "")] public Control ViewParent { get; private set; } Property Value Control Methods OnGuiFocusChanged(Node) When the focus changes, hide the calendar if the new focus is not a child of the calendar. private void OnGuiFocusChanged(Node focus) Parameters focus Node SetView(ICalendarView) Change the view. public void SetView(ICalendarView view) Parameters view ICalendarView The new view. _EnterTree() Called when the node enters the Godot.SceneTree (e.g. upon instantiating, scene changing, or after calling AddChild(Node, bool, InternalMode) in a script). If the node has children, its Godot.Node._EnterTree() callback will be called first, and then that of the children. Corresponds to the Godot.Node.NotificationEnterTree notification in _Notification(int). public override void _EnterTree() _ExitTree() Called when the node is about to leave the Godot.SceneTree (e.g. upon freeing, scene changing, or after calling Godot.Node.RemoveChild(Godot.Node) in a script). If the node has children, its Godot.Node._ExitTree() callback will be called last, after all its children have left the tree. Corresponds to the Godot.Node.NotificationExitTree notification in _Notification(int) and signal Godot.Node.TreeExiting. To get notified when the node has already left the active tree, connect to the Godot.Node.TreeExited. public override void _ExitTree() _GuiInput(InputEvent) Virtual method to be implemented by the user. Use this method to process and accept inputs on UI elements. See Godot.Control.AcceptEvent(). Example usage for clicking a control: public override void _GuiInput(InputEvent @event) { if (@event is InputEventMouseButton mb) { if (mb.ButtonIndex == MouseButton.Left && mb.Pressed) { GD.Print("I've been clicked D:"); } } } The event won't trigger if: * clicking outside the control (see Godot.Control._HasPoint(Godot.Vector2)); * control has Godot.Control.MouseFilter set to Godot.Control.MouseFilterEnum.Ignore; * control is obstructed by another Godot.Control on top of it, which doesn't have Godot.Control.MouseFilter set to Godot.Control.MouseFilterEnum.Ignore; * control's parent has Godot.Control.MouseFilter set to Godot.Control.MouseFilterEnum.Stop or has accepted the event; * it happens outside the parent's rectangle and the parent has either Godot.Control.ClipContents enabled. Note: Event position is relative to the control origin. public override void _GuiInput(InputEvent @event) Parameters event InputEvent _Process(double) Called during the processing step of the main loop. Processing happens at every frame and as fast as possible, so the delta time since the previous frame is not constant. delta is in seconds. It is only called if processing is enabled, which is done automatically if this method is overridden, and can be toggled with SetProcess(bool). Corresponds to the Godot.Node.NotificationProcess notification in _Notification(int). Note: This method is only called if the node is present in the scene tree (i.e. if it's not an orphan). public override void _Process(double delta) Parameters delta double _Ready() Called when the node is "ready", i.e. when both the node and its children have entered the scene tree. If the node has children, their Godot.Node._Ready() callbacks get triggered first, and the parent node will receive the ready notification afterwards. Corresponds to the Godot.Node.NotificationReady notification in _Notification(int). See also the @onready annotation for variables. Usually used for initialization. For even earlier initialization, Godot.GodotObject.GodotObject() may be used. See also Godot.Node._EnterTree(). Note: This method may be called only once for each node. After removing a node from the scene tree and adding it again, Godot.Node._Ready() will not be called a second time. This can be bypassed by requesting another call with Godot.Node.RequestReady(), which may be called anywhere before adding the node again. public override void _Ready() Events DateChanged The signal emitted when the date changes. public event Calendar.DateChangedEventHandler DateChanged Event Type Calendar.DateChangedEventHandler DateSelected The signal emitted when the user selects a date in ANY view. Emitted when selecting both a month and a day. public event Calendar.DateSelectedEventHandler DateSelected Event Type Calendar.DateSelectedEventHandler Finished The signal emitted when the user is finished selecting a date. Meaning, the user has selected a date in EVERY view (i.e. a month and a day). public event Calendar.FinishedEventHandler Finished Event Type Calendar.FinishedEventHandler ViewChanged The signal emitted when the view changes. public event Calendar.ViewChangedEventHandler ViewChanged Event Type Calendar.ViewChangedEventHandler

[Export(PropertyHint.None, "")] public Calendar Calendar { get; set; } Property Value Calendar Methods _Ready() Called when the node is "ready", i.e. when both the node and its children have entered the scene tree. If the node has children, their Godot.Node._Ready() callbacks get triggered first, and the parent node will receive the ready notification afterwards. Corresponds to the Godot.Node.NotificationReady notification in _Notification(int). See also the @onready annotation for variables. Usually used for initialization. For even earlier initialization, Godot.GodotObject.GodotObject() may be used. See also Godot.Node._EnterTree(). Note: This method may be called only once for each node. After removing a node from the scene tree and adding it again, Godot.Node._Ready() will not be called a second time. This can be bypassed by requesting another call with Godot.Node.RequestReady(), which may be called anywhere before adding the node again. public override void _Ready()

object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Properties Calendar The calendar that this view is a part of. [Export(PropertyHint.None, "")] public Calendar Calendar { get; set; } Property Value Calendar Methods Next() When the user clicks the next button (i.e. go to the next year). public void Next() Previous() When the user clicks the previous button (i.e. go to the previous year). public void Previous() Refresh() Update the view to reflect the selected date. public void Refresh() _Ready() Called when the node is "ready", i.e. when both the node and its children have entered the scene tree. If the node has children, their Godot.Node._Ready() callbacks get triggered first, and the parent node will receive the ready notification afterwards. Corresponds to the Godot.Node.NotificationReady notification in _Notification(int). See also the @onready annotation for variables. Usually used for initialization. For even earlier initialization, Godot.GodotObject.GodotObject() may be used. See also Godot.Node._EnterTree(). Note: This method may be called only once for each node. After removing a node from the scene tree and adding it again, Godot.Node._Ready() will not be called a second time. This can be bypassed by requesting another call with Godot.Node.RequestReady(), which may be called anywhere before adding the node again. public override void _Ready()

api/DatePicker.html.title: Namespace DatePicker | Stargazer Data API
api/DatePicker.html.summary: Namespace DatePicker Classes Calendar A calendar that can be used to select a date from a set view. DateButton MonthView Displays the days in a month. YearView Displays the months of a year. Interfaces ICalendarView A view that dictates how a calendar should be displayed (i.e. MonthView or YearView). Delegates Calendar.DateChangedEventHandler The signal emitted when the date changes. Calendar.DateSelectedEventHandler The signal emitted when the user selects a date in ANY view. Emitted when selecting both a month and a day. Calendar.FinishedEventHandler The signal emitted when the user is finished selecting a date. Meaning, the user has selected a date in EVERY view (i.e. a month and a day). Calendar.ViewChangedEventHandler The signal emitted when the view changes.

bool requestTime public DateTime requestTime { get; set; } Property Value DateTime Methods _Ready() Called when the node is "ready", i.e. when both the node and its children have entered the scene tree. If the node has children, their Godot.Node._Ready() callbacks get triggered first, and the parent node will receive the ready notification afterwards. Corresponds to the Godot.Node.NotificationReady notification in _Notification(int). See also the @onready annotation for variables. Usually used for initialization. For even earlier initialization, Godot.GodotObject.GodotObject() may be used. See also Godot.Node._EnterTree(). Note: This method may be called only once for each node. After removing a node from the scene tree and adding it again, Godot.Node._Ready() will not be called a second time. This can be bypassed by requesting another call with Godot.Node.RequestReady(), which may be called anywhere before adding the node again. public override void _Ready()

If the node has children, their Godot.Node._Ready() callbacks get triggered first, and the parent node will receive the ready notification afterwards. Corresponds to the Godot.Node.NotificationReady notification in _Notification(int). See also the @onready annotation for variables. Usually used for initialization. For even earlier initialization, Godot.GodotObject.GodotObject() may be used. See also Godot.Node._EnterTree(). Note: This method may be called only once for each node. After removing a node from the scene tree and adding it again, Godot.Node._Ready() will not be called a second time. This can be bypassed by requesting another call with Godot.Node.RequestReady(), which may be called anywhere before adding the node again. public override void _Ready()

Task UpdateUserPosition(CelestialDataPackage<Star> dataPackage, DateTime currentTime, (string, string) latLong) Parameters dataPackage CelestialDataPackage<Star> currentTime DateTime latLong (string, string) Returns Task _Ready() Called when the node is "ready", i.e. when both the node and its children have entered the scene tree. If the node has children, their Godot.Node._Ready() callbacks get triggered first, and the parent node will receive the ready notification afterwards. Corresponds to the Godot.Node.NotificationReady notification in _Notification(int). See also the @onready annotation for variables. Usually used for initialization. For even earlier initialization, Godot.GodotObject.GodotObject() may be used. See also Godot.Node._EnterTree(). Note: This method may be called only once for each node. After removing a node from the scene tree and adding it again, Godot.Node._Ready() will not be called a second time. This can be bypassed by requesting another call with Godot.Node.RequestReady(), which may be called anywhere before adding the node again. public override void _Ready()

Returns Task<IDictionary<int, Star2D>> SpawnStar(Star) private Star2D SpawnStar(Star godotStar) Parameters godotStar Star Returns Star2D _Ready() Called when the node is "ready", i.e. when both the node and its children have entered the scene tree. If the node has children, their Godot.Node._Ready() callbacks get triggered first, and the parent node will receive the ready notification afterwards. Corresponds to the Godot.Node.NotificationReady notification in _Notification(int). See also the @onready annotation for variables. Usually used for initialization. For even earlier initialization, Godot.GodotObject.GodotObject() may be used. See also Godot.Node._EnterTree(). Note: This method may be called only once for each node. After removing a node from the scene tree and adding it again, Godot.Node._Ready() will not be called a second time. This can be bypassed by requesting another call with Godot.Node.RequestReady(), which may be called anywhere before adding the node again. public override void _Ready()

_Process(double) Called during the processing step of the main loop. Processing happens at every frame and as fast as possible, so the delta time since the previous frame is not constant. delta is in seconds. It is only called if processing is enabled, which is done automatically if this method is overridden, and can be toggled with SetProcess(bool). Corresponds to the Godot.Node.NotificationProcess notification in _Notification(int). Note: This method is only called if the node is present in the scene tree (i.e. if it's not an orphan). public override void _Process(double delta) Parameters delta double

string StarName { get; } Property Value string Methods From3dStar(Star) public void From3dStar(Star star) Parameters star Star _Ready() Called when the node is "ready", i.e. when both the node and its children have entered the scene tree. If the node has children, their Godot.Node._Ready() callbacks get triggered first, and the parent node will receive the ready notification afterwards. Corresponds to the Godot.Node.NotificationReady notification in _Notification(int). See also the @onready annotation for variables. Usually used for initialization. For even earlier initialization, Godot.GodotObject.GodotObject() may be used. See also Godot.Node._EnterTree(). Note: This method may be called only once for each node. After removing a node from the scene tree and adding it again, Godot.Node._Ready() will not be called a second time. This can be bypassed by requesting another call with Godot.Node.RequestReady(), which may be called anywhere before adding the node again. public override void _Ready() getLocation() private Vector2 getLocation() Returns Vector2 scalestar(Vector2) public void scalestar(Vector2 scale) Parameters scale Vector2

latField Field Value Node longField private Node longField Field Value Node timeField private LineEdit timeField Field Value LineEdit Methods ButtonPressed() private void ButtonPressed() OnDateSelected(object) private void OnDateSelected(object dateObj) Parameters dateObj object _Ready() Called when the node is "ready", i.e. when both the node and its children have entered the scene tree. If the node has children, their Godot.Node._Ready() callbacks get triggered first, and the parent node will receive the ready notification afterwards. Corresponds to the Godot.Node.NotificationReady notification in _Notification(int). See also the @onready annotation for variables. Usually used for initialization. For even earlier initialization, Godot.GodotObject.GodotObject() may be used. See also Godot.Node._EnterTree(). Note: This method may be called only once for each node. After removing a node from the scene tree and adding it again, Godot.Node._Ready() will not be called a second time. This can be bypassed by requesting another call with Godot.Node.RequestReady(), which may be called anywhere before adding the node again. public override void _Ready()

api/Stargazer.ZoomState.html.title: Enum ZoomState | Stargazer Data API
api/Stargazer.ZoomState.html.summary: Enum ZoomState Namespace Stargazer Assembly New Game Project.dll Used to implement quantum logic in the view based on Fov thresholds. Author: Josh Johner Created: SPR 2025 public enum ZoomState Fields FullIn = 2 The viewport Fov is in the fully zoomed in region. FullOut = 0 The viewport Fov is in the full zoomed out region. Middle = 1 The viewport Fov is in the middle zoom region.

api/Stargazer.html.title: Namespace Stargazer | Stargazer Data API
api/Stargazer.html.summary: Namespace Stargazer Classes ASTRALPLANEAlbedo Handles the transparency of the floor. Author: Logan Parker Created: SPR 2025 AzimuthGridlines The graphic object used to draw the lines. Author: William Arnett Created: SPR 2025 CelestialBody Represents a body drawn in 3D space that can be viewed, hovered and targeted. Author: Josh Johner Created: SPR 2025 CompassNeedle Displays a compass needle to orient the user relative to North. Author: Logan Parker Refactored By: Josh Johner (moved needle.RotationDegrees from _Process() to RotationHandler Created: SPR 2025 Constellations The Godot.Node3D used to contain the constellation stars and lines in the viewport. Author: Logan Parker Created: SPR 2025 Refactored by Josh Johner (SPR 2025) for concurrency and observer patterns. Constellations2D The Godot.Node2D used to contain the constellation stars and lines in the viewport. Author: William Arnett Created: SPR 2025 ControlContainer Contains all user controls for the program and notifies subscribers of user interaction. Author: Josh Johner Created: SPR 2025 Globals Currently is no longer being used due to Actions and Delegates GridLabel Displays the latitude value on the grid. Author: William Arnett Created: SPR 2025 Refactored by Josh Johner (SPR 2025) to use observer pattern. HoverLabel The label that is displayed when hovering over an IHoverable object. Author: Logan Parker Created: SPR 2025 Refactored by Josh Johner (SPR 2025) to use observer pattern. LabelNode Contains the constellation label. Author: Logan Parker Created: SPR 2025 MainCamera Contains the main camera used to create the user view. Author: Logan Parker Created: SPR 2025 Refactored by Josh Johner (SPR 2025) to use ICameraStateNotifier to implement observer pattern. MessierObject A Messier Deep Space Object drawn in the sky. Author: Josh Johner Created: SPR 2025 Refactored by William Arnett (SPR 2025) to implement hover text. Moon A moon object to be drawn. Author: Josh Johner Created: SPR 2025 Refactored by William Arnett (SPR 2025) to handle rotation and get hover text. Planet Used to draw a planet in the SkyView Author: Josh Johner Created: SPR 2025 Refactored by William Arnett (SPR 2025) to use custom shader material. Planets A Godot.Node3D container for the planets. Author: Josh Johner Created: SPR 2025 Refactored by William Arnett (SPR 2025) to use custom shader. PlayControl Controls the play speed of the 3D simulation. Author: Josh Johner Created: SPR 2025 PlaySpeed A state object to control the play speed of the simulation Author: Josh Johner Created: SPR 2025 SkyView The parent object for all items in the viewport. Responsible for relaying notifications from senders throughout the program into the view port. Author: Josh Johner Created: SPR 2025 SkyView2D Used to create the 2D star scene (for screenshot export). Author: William Arnett Created: SPR 2025 Refactored by Josh Johner (SPR 2025) for containerization improvement. SkyViewContainer The parent container of the SkyView object (used for anchoring). Author: Josh Johner Created: SPR 2025 Spawner Draws all stars that are not a part of constellations Author: Logan Parker Created: SPR 2025 Refactored by Josh Johner (SPR 2025) for concurrency and single responsibility. Spawner2D Draws all stars that are not a part of constellations Author: William Arnett Created: SPR 2025 Refactored by Josh Johner (SPR 2025) to use IDictionary. Star A star that has been converted from Horizontal Coordinate form, into Godot coordinate form and drawn to the screen. Author: Logan Parker Created: SPR 2025 Refactored by Josh Johner (SPR 2025) to implement CelestialBody Star2D A star that has been converted from Horizontal Coordinate form, into Godot coordinate form and drawn to the screen. Author: William Arnett Created: SPR 2025 StarMesh This was originally created to explore adding color to the stars. The current implementation is way too aggressive. We might be able to make this work by tweaking the numbers. Author: Josh Johner Created: SPR 2025 Startup The top level controller for the program. Handles all communication between the GUI and the viewport. Author: Josh Johner Created: SPR 2025 Refactored by Alex Lake (SPR 2025) to implement screenshot. Sun The actual sun.
